  physical_appearance: This is an annotated map of the Malay Peninsular. The map is printed in multiple colours including black
 beige and red. There are several penned annotations
 marking out places and interest
 written in blue ink. The map is quite worn
 with the fold lines stained and the edges creased and slightly torn.

  sgcool_label_text: This map belonged to George Dudley Binsted
 a former Changi POW. This map of the Malay Peninsular was issued by the Royal Air Force (RAF)
 which Binsted had kept throughout his years of captivity and after. The map contains hand markings
 which were believed to be the escape route he had planned. Binsted joined the Royal Air Force in 1941 and had flown Spitfires over France before being posted to Java. After the fall of Singapore in February 1942
 Binsted along with four others
 were captured by the Japanese. They were transported by ship to Singapore
 where they spent the next three and a half years as POWs in Changi Prison.

metadata.title_text: 1941 RAF map of the Malay Peninsular
metadata.physical_appearance: This is an annotated map of the Malay Peninsular. The map is printed in multiple colours including black, beige and red. There are several penned annotations, marking out places and interest, written in blue ink. The map is quite worn, with the fold lines stained and the edges creased and slightly torn.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This map belonged to George Dudley Binsted, a former Changi POW. This map of the Malay Peninsular was issued by the Royal Air Force (RAF), which Binsted had kept throughout his years of captivity and after. The map contains hand markings, which were believed to be the escape route he had planned. Binsted joined the Royal Air Force in 1941 and had flown Spitfires over France before being posted to Java. After the fall of Singapore in February 1942, Binsted along with four others, were captured by the Japanese. They were transported by ship to Singapore, where they spent the next three and a half years as POWs in Changi Prison.
